I really learned everything useful for clinical trial in this class. It worth my tuition fee. Professor Peter is also very kind to international students. I appreciate this.

Overall, it was an interesting topic. I took this class because I was interested in taking the clinical trials class in the fall semester but could not. This course does not require that one as a prerequisite and I was told by a classmate that this one was much more enjoyable. We had a very small and intimate class. There were definitely things that I learned from this class, but it was not very rigorous and did not really add a semester's worth of knowledge for me (someone who has minimal understanding of statistics, etc). It is a good class to take when you want to gain some knowledge in this area but do not want a rigorous class (its somewhat like a filler class thats an easy A in undergrad, but looks like you've taken something really useful). Overall, I appreciated the class content, but perhaps something with more rigor would be even more valuable at the Masters level.
